Appleseed builtins¶

These functions and macros are built in to the Appleseed interpreter. All of them, unlike library functions and macros, have type Builtin.

Arithmetic¶

add¶

Adds two numbers. Arguments must be Int or Bool; returns Int.

sub¶

Subtracts two numbers. Arguments must be Int or Bool; returns Int.

mul¶

Multiplies two numbers. Arguments must be Int or Bool; returns Int.

div¶

Divides two numbers. Note that this is integer division, rounding down: (div 5 3) is 1; (div -5 3) is -2. Arguments must be Int or Bool; returns Int. Errors if the second argument is 0 (or false).

mod¶

Takes two numbers; returns its first argument modulo its second. Follows the same rules as Python regarding negative arguments: the return value is constrained to be between the second argument (exclusive) and zero (inclusive). As a result, (add (mul (div a b) b) (mod a b)) is always equal to a. Arguments must be Int or Bool; returns Int. Errors if the second argument is 0 (or false).
